description: On February 5, 2021, the Government of Mozambique imposed a curfew on the Greater Maputo Metropolitan Area (Maputo city, the adjoining city of Matola, the municipality of Boane and the town of Marracuene) until March 7, 2021. People must stay home from 9 pm to 4 am, except in the event of medical emergencies. The curfew does not apply to essential workers.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
target_city: The Greater Maputo Metropolitan Area: Maputo city, the adjoining city of Matola, the municipality of Boane and the town of Marracuene.
target_who_gen: Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description: Republic of Mozambique, August 8, 2020: the President declared the State of Emergency across the national territory for 30 days until September 6, 2020. Violation will be punished by a penalty of 3 to 15 days in prison. The police will monitor compliance, but the Defense and Security Forces, municipal and local, can also be called in to ensure compliance.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On September 04, 2020, in Mozambique: President Nyusi announced that the state of emergency, will be replaced by a situation of public calamity from September 07, 2020 that will last indefinitely. Failure to obey the regulations can be punished in terms of the legislation on civil disobedience and offences against public health.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On September 04, 2020, in Mozambique: President Nyusi announced that the state of emergency, will be replaced by a situation of public calamity from September 07, 2020 that will last indefinitely. Failure to obey the regulations can be punished in terms of the legislation on civil disobedience and offences against public health. UPDATE: On April 20, 2022, Mozambique transitioned from a State of Public Calamity to a Public Health Emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: All incoming travelers must present a negative test for COVID-19.
